summary: This is an automated email failure notification from the US Department of Justice, indicating that a message regarding subpoenas for Ghislaine Maxwell was blocked because it contained possible sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and was not properly encrypted. The document highlights internal DOJ security protocols for handling sensitive information.

events.title: DOJ Memorandum on Safeguarding PII
events.description: The Department of Justice issued a memorandum titled 'Safeguarding Personally Identifiable Information', establishing security protocols for handling sensitive information.

events.title: Failed Email Regarding Maxwell Subpoenas
events.description: An email with the subject 'RE: Subpoenas Re Ghislaine Maxwell' was blocked by the DOJ's email system for containing possible sensitive PII without proper encryption.

keyFacts: The document is an automated failure notice from the US Department of Justice email system dated August 16, 2019.
It indicates an email regarding subpoenas for Ghislaine Maxwell was blocked for containing possible sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (PII) without proper encryption.
The notice references a DOJ memorandum from April 16, 2015, that mandates encryption for PII sent externally and prohibits sending such information to personal email addresses.
The subject line of the blocked message was 'RE: Subpoenas Re Ghislaine Maxwell', directly linking the communication to the ongoing investigation into Maxwell.
The document demonstrates the DOJ's internal security protocols for handling sensitive case-related information during the Epstein/Maxwell investigations.
